content: ends either into the chain or into the rounds of webbing pattern for corner webbing similar to the side webbing using colour c make a slip knot and slip_stitch the yarn at the top of r2 on the centre front of the blanket make a chain long enough to reach the outer corner slip_stitch to the outer corner and c1 turn the blanket to be able to slip_stitch back along the chain holding the yarn to the back of the blanket all the way back to the beginning chain you can access the yarn from the front by pulling a small piece through the spaces made in the corner of each row fo back at the centre of blanket tie your ends together in a sturdy knot and trim yarn repeat in all 4 corners this method gives the straightest and flattest webbing alternatively you can make a chain and slip stich around each row on the way back to the centre of the blanket finishing touches using pins or stitch markers arrange the spider applique over the centre front of the blanket the first and fourth leg on each side of the spider should be arranged over the corner webbing the middle two legs should be arranged over the side webbing and the head and bottom should be centred along the side webbing for the top and bottom of the blanket using either colour c yarn or the long yarn tail of the spider applique sew the applique to the blanket this should cover all the ends of the webbing in the centre of the blanket 0 a tutorial for this blanket is available @mylittleyarnontheprairie youtube channel
